title: The Sizes of Small Solar System Objects

previous.title: The History of the Solar System

content:
Sometimes itâ€™s useful to know the size of an object. Consider the case for asteroid mining: a large asteroid would produce more raw materials, and therefore have a higher economic potential. Or what if a newly discovered object seems to be on a collision course with Earth? Knowing its size would help us to predict the potential damage it could cause. The size is also a critical factor in determining what sort of strategy we would use to deflect the object.
